Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
AIPlayer, HumanPlayer
public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class that has the properties of a Go Fish player

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand

    private int numBooks

    Asks the next player for a given card type

    Checks to see if the player's hand contains a book of four cards.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of a player.
      Returns:
      A string containing the player's name.

    • setName

      public void setName​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Sets the name of a player.
      Parameters:
      playerName - A string to set the player name to.

    • hasCard

      public boolean hasCard​(Card cardType)
      Checks if a card has been given to another player
      Parameters:
      cardType - a card value (ace, one, jack, king, etc...)
      Returns:
      True is the players hand contains the cardType, otherwise false

    • giveCard

      public java.util.ArrayList<Card> giveCard​(Card cardType)
      Returns an array of cards to give to another player given a card type to look for
      Parameters:
      cardType - a card value
      Returns:
      an array of the cards that are being given

    • askFor

      public boolean askFor​(Card cardType, Player target)
      Asks the next player for a given card type
      Parameters:
      cardType - a card value
      Returns:
      a boolean representing if the next player has the card type asked for

    • fish

      public Card fish()
      Allows a player to fish for a card if needed, and then adds the card to the player's hand.
      Returns:
      A card, which is either the card taken from the deck or null if the deck is empty.

    • getNumBooks

      public int getNumBooks()
      Gets the number of books that a player has won. Acts as the score keeping mechanism for a player.
      Returns:
      The score of the player in "books"

    • checkForBooks

      public Card checkForBooks()
      Checks to see if the player's hand contains a book of four cards.
      Returns:
      The book of cards that was generated, or null, indicating that a book was not created.

    • haveTurn

      public abstract void haveTurn​(int turn)
      A placeholder method that will serve as a means of instituting any type of player's turn in a game of Go Fish.
      Parameters:
      turn - The turn number
